Local file import for Power Virtual Agents topic suggestions

Submitted Thursday Submitted by yokomizo Thursday
In the current function, topic suggestions are limited to online files and those that do not require authentication. It is inconvenient for BOTs used within the company to be able to propose topics only for public information. It is inconvenient for bots used internally to target only public information. I would like to see a function to automatically create topics for locally stored Q&As and Q&As uploaded to SharePoint. ... View more
Status: New

Finnish language for PVA

Submitted on ‎01-07-2021 04:25 AM Submitted by Janne-Hirva on ‎01-07-2021 04:25 AM
PVA should learn Finnish much like it knows many other languages. The users in many first line worker scenarios would be more likely to use a bot that speaks their language. It's quite clunky to make an English speaking bot to ask questions in Finnish, quite often there are things the bot needs to collect in Finnish.   ... View more

Duplicate Power Virtual Agents BOTs in the same solution in Power Apps.

Submitted on ‎09-13-2020 10:53 PM Submitted by kaznakaxx on ‎09-13-2020 10:53 PM
Duplicate Power Virtual Agents BOTs in the same solution in Power Apps.   One feature that is different from the export/import feature of the Power Apps solution is the ability to replicate a BOT within the same solution.   The uses of the replicated bots are as follows   1.Template for creating multiple BOTs that perform similar processing. 2.Backup of a BOT under development ... Submitted on ‎07-28-2020 06:32 AM Submitted by LinkeD365 on ‎07-28-2020 06:32 AM
Global variables are a great addition, but not being able to reset them is annoying.   Moreover, when I call flow with variables, I can not set these manually. This leads to multiple flow calls when one would have done, increasing solution complexity and is less manageable.   Please give the customiser the option to define the value of a variable. This would allow us to change a global variable and fill a variable. ... View more
